name: The Beast
specialElements: Two lift hills (110' & 141' drops); 540° banked helix tunnel finale; three tunnels total; 35 acres of terrain; reprofiled first drop to 53°
records: World's longest wooden coaster (7,361'); Golden Ticket Awards perennial top 10; $3.5M cost in 1979 ($20M+ today)

name: Mystic Timbers
specialElements: 16 airtime hills; 'What's in the Shed?' mystery finale; Millennium Flyer articulated trains; 330K board-ft of lumber; 88K bolts
records: Best New Ride 2017 (Golden Ticket Awards); gave KI most wooden track of any park (18,804')

name: The Bat
specialElements: Cars swing freely side-to-side; originally 'Top Gun' (1993–2007); last Arrow suspended coaster still operating in US
records: One of only a few remaining Arrow suspended coasters worldwide

name: Backlot Stunt Coaster
specialElements: LIM electromagnetic launch; themed to movie car chase; fire & water effects along track; formerly 'Italian Job: Stunt Track'

name: The Racer
specialElements: Dual-track racing coaster (both tracks ~3,415'); PTC trains; helped launch modern coaster renaissance; featured in Brady Bunch episode (1973)
records: Credited with sparking the modern roller coaster boom of the 1970s

name: Woodstock Express
specialElements: Family/kiddie coaster; originally 'Scooby-Doo' (1972); Peanuts-themed; great first coaster for young riders

name: Rock 'n' Roller Coaster
specialElements: 0–57 mph in 2.8 sec (LSM launch); fully enclosed/dark; 900+ onboard speakers; Aerosmith soundtrack; serpent roll + corkscrew
records: First Disney coaster with inversions; first Disney coaster with a launch; being re-themed to Muppets

name: Seven Dwarfs Mine Train
specialElements: Cars swing side-to-side independently; animatronic dwarfs in mine scenes; family-friendly; New Fantasyland centerpiece

name: Slinky Dog Dash
specialElements: Two LSM launches; Toy Story Land centerpiece; themed as Andy's Mega Coaster Kit; family-friendly; outdoor layout

name: Expedition Everest
specialElements: Forward & backward sections via track switch; 22-ft Yeti animatronic ('Disco Yeti'); 199.5' mountain structure; $100M cost; 6 trains
records: Most expensive coaster ever built ($100M) until Hagrid's 2019; tallest structure at WDW (199.5')

name: The Barnstormer
specialElements: Goofy's barnyard theme; family/kiddie coaster; short but fun first coaster for young kids; Storybook Circus area

name: Big Thunder Mountain Railroad
specialElements: Runaway mine train theme; three lift hills; elaborate Western desert theming; animatronic animals & effects; 'wildest ride in the wilderness'
records: Classic Disney E-ticket attraction since 1980

name: Guardians of the Galaxy: Cosmic Rewind
specialElements: World's first reverse-launch Disney coaster; Omnicoaster vehicles rotate 360° to face action; indoor ride; randomized soundtrack (5+ songs)
records: World's longest fully enclosed coaster (4,769'); first coaster at EPCOT

name: Blue Ridge Mountain Coaster
specialElements: Rider-controlled braking; individual sleds; scenic mountain descent; Great Smoky Mountains setting

name: Woodstock Express
specialElements: Family/kiddie coaster; Peanuts-themed; great first coaster for young riders

name: Fury 325
specialElements: 81° first drop; hornet theme; teal/lime track, white supports; crosses NC/SC state line; 2,700 tons of steel; 8.4 acres; camelback hills + double helix
records: World's tallest giga coaster (325'); #1 Steel Coaster (Golden Ticket Awards since 2016); Best New Ride 2015

name: Thunder Striker
specialElements: Formerly 'Intimidator' (Dale Earnhardt theme removed 2024); 74° first drop; multiple airtime hills; B&M hyper trains; open-air seating
records: Originally named after NASCAR legend Dale Earnhardt; renamed 2024 after license expired

name: Carolina Cyclone
specialElements: 2 vertical loops + 2 barrel rolls; Arrow classic looper; one of earliest 4-inversion coasters; 1980s steel classic
records: One of the first coasters ever built with 4 inversions

name: Ricochet
specialElements: Sharp 90° hairpin turns; small cars; sudden drops; compact layout; family-friendly thrill

name: Montu
specialElements: 7 inversions: 104' vertical loop, Immelmann, zero-G roll, batwing, 60' loop, corkscrew; feet-dangling; Egypt-themed; navy blue track
records: First coaster with an Immelmann loop; world's tallest/fastest inverted at opening (1996); 7 inversions ties record for inverted coasters

name: SheiKra
specialElements: 90° vertical first drop (200'); holding brake pauses train at top; Immelmann inversion; 138' second drop into underground tunnel; splashdown finale; converted to floorless 2007
records: First dive coaster in the US; first floorless dive coaster (2007 retrofit)

name: Iron Gwazi
specialElements: 91° beyond-vertical first drop; 12 airtime moments; RMC I-Box steel track on wooden structure; converted from Gwazi wooden coaster; delayed 2 yrs by COVID
records: North America's tallest hybrid coaster (206'); steepest drop on a hybrid (91°); first beyond-vertical hybrid drop

name: Kumba
specialElements: 7 inversions: 114' vertical loop (wraps lift hill), dive loop, zero-G roll, cobra roll, 2 interlocking corkscrews; 'Kumba' means 'roar' in Kikongo
records: First coaster with a dive loop; first with interlocking corkscrews; tallest vertical loop when opened (1993); Golden Ticket top 50 every year since 1998

name: Phoenix Rising
specialElements: Family-friendly inverted coaster; feet-dangling; replaced Sand Serpent; Pantopia area; accessible to younger riders (42" with companion)
records: North America's tallest & longest family inverted coaster at opening

name: Tigris
specialElements: Triple-launch forward & backward; heartline roll inversion; 150' beyond-vertical spike; compact footprint; launched shuttle-style

name: Cheetah Hunt
specialElements: Three LSM launches (35/60/40 mph); heartline roll; figure-8 element; trenches over water; cheetah theme with adjacent live cheetah exhibit
records: Park's longest ride at 4,429'; features iconic figure-8 track element

name: Mako
specialElements: 9 airtime moments; hammerhead turn; open-air B&M hyper trains; mako shark theme; 200' first drop; Orlando's signature hyper
records: Orlando's tallest, fastest & longest coaster at opening (2016)

name: Pipeline: The Surf Coaster
specialElements: World's first surf coaster; standing/surfboard-position seats that pitch forward dynamically; wave-themed elements; 1 inversion
records: World's first B&M Surf Coaster model

name: Kraken
specialElements: 7 inversions; floorless trains (no floor beneath riders' feet); sea monster theme; zero-G roll, cobra roll, vertical loops, corkscrews; formerly had VR overlay (2017–18, removed)
records: First floorless coaster in the Southeast US at opening
